revised_title: Investigating Solar Periodicities and Their Impact on Temperature Ranges
tldr: The authors analyzed temperature ranges from Kew, Utrecht, and Toronto observatories to study the existence of short periods common to solar and terrestrial phenomena. They discovered that these temperature ranges indicate the existence of inequalities of the same periods, suggesting a cosmical origin. The authors also found that the phases of these inequalities may not be simultaneous at different locations, and they proposed a method to bring the phases more in line with one another. This research could help in understanding the relationship between solar activity and weather patterns.
